name: NPR
text:
Texas reported more than 10,000 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday ‚Äî eclipsing its previous record for single-day increases, which the state set on Saturday.
https://t.co/YmtsY8qZoF

name: NPR
text:
Federal regulators revoked a rule that requires payday lenders to check that borrowers can repay loans, which can carry interest rates as high as 400%. 

The new rule strips a key provision crafted during the Obama administration.
https://t.co/t7JVMqDh5q

name: NPR
text:
New daily coronavirus cases are rising in 45 states and Puerto Rico, an NPR analysis shows. 

Here's how much cases are up compared to 2 weeks ago:

üìà Louisiana: +202%
üìà Idaho: +170%
üìà Florida: +163%

name: NPR
text:
Amy Kennedy won the Democratic primary for New Jersey‚Äôs 2nd congressional district, the AP projects. She will face Rep. Jeff Van Drew, who switched to the Republican party, pledging "undying support" to Trump.
https://t.co/EfxbKJhnbC

name: NPR
text:
5 states and D.C. are suing the Education Department, accusing the Trump administration of trying to unlawfully divert pandemic relief funds from public schools to private schools.
https://t.co/14kjL43Hnl

name: NPR
text: The Jayhawks' bandleader Gary Louris talks about the band‚Äôs songwriting process, plus his collaborations with other people, including the newly renamed trio The Chicks ‚Äî who you might know better as Dixie Chicks.  https://t.co/9oUFSFoKR7

name: NPR
text:
Author Larry Tye draws a parallel between Sen. Joseph McCarthy's infamous smear campaign and President Trump's divisive rhetoric, saying both are "bullies" who exploit fears and "point fingers when they're attacked."
https://t.co/QbnyVGt2dT

name: NPR
text:
Surfing has long been a bro culture, but more photos of women surfing have encouraged more women to get in the water.

"Can't be what you can't see,‚Äù photographer Sachi Cunningham says.
https://t.co/MK4PgfpVPC

name: NPR
text:
Black women killed by police haven‚Äôt been highlighted in the same way as Black men, says Kimberl√© Crenshaw, co-founder of #SayHerName.
 
‚ÄúIf we can say their names we can know more about their stories."

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Tammy Duckworth tells NPR that she still hasn't been assured by Defense Secretary Mark Esper that the administration won't block the routine promotion of impeachment witness Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman.
https://t.co/LFIosB6OmR

name: NPR
text:
"We have an honor code: A cadet will not lie, cheat, steal or tolerate those who do," says Capt. Mary Tobin, a former West Point cadet. "We have an entire program devoted to that. ... That should also happen in regards to issues of racism."
https://t.co/Yq0Infe5Ay

name: NPR
text:
In a letter to the United Nations, President Trump declared the U.S. will terminate membership in the World Health Organization.

Global health experts say the move ‚Äúwill likely cost lives, American and foreign" to COVID-19.
